description.narrative: Output 1.1: The effectiveness of social assistance in reducing the vulnerability of children and their families is strengthened the revised national subsistence minimum is equity-based and child-friendly and the social model of disability is incorporated into relevant legislation.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Kazakhstan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Adolescent and Youth)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Child Injury Prevention)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Children with Disabilities)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Early Childhood Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Kazakhstan: Evaluation of PHC Impact on Infant and Child Mortality Reduction: Assessment of the Universal Progressive Home Visiting Model
2019 Kazakhstan: Joint Evaluation of National Programmes to Reduce Infant and Child Mortality in Kazakhstan
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Gaps in targeting and eligibility approaches for social benefits and social services programmes were addressed progressively in 2019. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/12/2019

title.narrative: Amount (in national currency) allocated from the national budget to new (or expanded) COVID-19 social protection programmes that directly or indirectly benefit children (including on-budget development partner funds) in the reporting year [COVID]

Cash transfers: Cash transfer system is being effectively IMPLEMENTED including the expanding coverage and improving inclususion of children (e.g. beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms)

actual.value: 2019:Targeting methodology of TSA program was revised (in April 2019) and child-sensitive

title.narrative: Degree of alignment of national standards on identification and measurement of disability with ICF methodology

baseline.value: National standards on identification and measurement of disability are not aligned with the ICF methodology

target.value: 2020:National standards on identification and measurement of disability is fully aligned with ICF methodology

actual.value: 2019:Analysis of PMPC role and its links with schools with focus on ICF is initiated instead of review of early intervention services
